thread.title: Shootings at two colleges; Pentagon halts Syrian rebel training; Paul Ryan considers House Speaker post: U.S. and World News Links
thread.title_full: Shootings at two colleges; Pentagon halts Syrian rebel training; Paul Ryan considers House Speaker post: U.S. and World News Links | cleveland.com

author: Ray Jablonski, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: Shootings at two colleges; Pentagon halts Syrian rebel training; Paul Ryan considers House Speaker post: U.S. and World News Links
text:
Today's top stories:
Texas Southern University was on lockdown much of the day today after a fatal shooting of a freshman at a campus apartment complex that also sent one person to the hospital. ( Washington Post ) An 18-year-old student killed one peer and wounded three others when he opened fire during a confrontation on the Northern Arizona University campus early today before being arrested. ( Reuters )
The Pentagon says it is halting its troubled program to build Syrian rebel units to fight the Islamic State and focus instead on training and arming vetted leaders already on the ground. ( Sky News )
House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy, whose decision to drop his bid for speaker Thursday stunned his colleagues, said today Paul Ryan is considering the job, as pressure mounts on the Wisconsin Republican to jump into the race. ( USA Today )
National news:
Holding signs saying the president was not welcome, more than 200 gun-rights activists protested Barack Obama's visit today to Oregon to meet with the families of victims of last week's campus killings. ( Associated Press )
A bipartisan group of House lawmakers joined today to force a vote in the coming weeks to reopen the Export-Import Bank, whose charter expired this summer because of opposition from key congressional leaders. ( Los Angeles Times )
An Arkansas judge issued an order today that temporarily blocked the scheduled executions of eight convicted murderers after lawyers for the death row inmates challenged secrecy provisions in the state's lethal injection procedures. ( Reuters )
Thousands of older wood and concrete apartment buildings vulnerable to collapse in a major earthquake would get costly upgrades under sweeping retrofitting rules passed today by the Los Angeles City Council. ( Associated Press )
A Washington, D.C., man was cited by police today for flying a small drone near the Washington Monument and landing it on the Ellipse adjacent to the White House, authorities said. ( Washington Post )
Staying for free at an overseas luxury hotel should be disclosed by U.S. lawmakers as a gift, a judge said in upholding the corruption indictment of Senator Robert Menendez, a New Jersey Democrat. ( Bloomberg News )
A prominent Chicago anti-violence program has lost its funding due to a political stalemate in the Illinois state government. ( Christian Science Monitor )
International news:
At least seven Palestinians were killed and 60 people were injured, 10 critically, in clashes today in Gaza, according to Gaza medical sources. ( CNN News )
Islamic State fighters have seized Syrian villages on the outskirts of Aleppo from rival insurgent fighters, a monitoring group said today, despite Russian air strikes Moscow says have targeted the militant group. ( Reuters )
Fire swept through a maximum-security Philippine prison, killing 10 inmates, most of them in their cells, authorities said today. ( Reuters )
An alliance of Tunisian workers, employers, lawyers and activists won the Nobel Peace Prize today, a decision meant to honor the quest for democracy in the nation that gave birth the Arab Spring as well as urge it on at a time when its still-tenuous gains are increasingly under threat. ( Washington Post )
Officials from Libya's rival parliaments have expressed doubts about a UN proposal for a national unity government, saying the announcement was premature. ( BBC News )
Under growing domestic pressure over her open-door policy on refugees, Germany's Angela Merkel has come out swinging, insisting "we will manage" the crisis set to define her nearly decade-old chancellorship. ( AFP News )
